alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 9:03PM PDT until August 20 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Tulare. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 902 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.3 and 0.6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tulare, Porterville, Terra Bella, Ducor, East Porterville, Poplar-Cotton Center, Strathmore, Woodville, Fountain Springs and Pixley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
